book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: Abu al-Abbas Ahmad bin Umar bin Anas al-Udhri informed us in Al-Jazirah, and I read to him; he said: Abu Bakr Abdullah bin al-Husayn bin Uqal al-Muradi and Abu Muhammad Makki bin Ali Ibn Absun al-Muradi informed us in Makkah in the Sacred Mosque (Al-Masjid Al-Haram) in the month of Rabi' al-Awwal in the year four hundred and twelve. They said: Abu al-Qasim Ubayd Allah bin Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Ja'far al-Saqati told us by his reading in the Sacred Mosque—may Allah the Exalted preserve it. He said: Abu Muhammad Ja'far bin Muhammad bin al-Khawwas informed us by reading to him while I was listening. He said: Abu Ja'far Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah told us, he said: I said to Ali bin Abdullah al-Madini: 'O Abu al-Hasan, Yahya bin Ma'in mentioned to us that some Sheikhs from the Basrans were accused of Qadar (believing in free will/denying divine decree), except that they did not invite others to it, nor did they bring anything denounced (Munkar) regarding it in their Hadith. Among them were Qatadah and Hisham, the companion of al-Dastawa'i...'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: ...and Sa'id bin Abi Arubah, Abu Hilal, Abdul-Warith, and Salam. They were trustworthy (Thiqat); their Hadith is written, and they died while they held the view of Qadar and did not retract from it.' So Ali, may Allah have mercy on him, said to me: 'Abu Zakariya [Yahya bin Ma'in] used to say this according to us, except that our companions mentioned that Hisham al-Dastawa'i retracted before his death, but that has not been authenticated according to us.' Muhammad bin Uthman told us, he said: I asked Ali bin Abdullah about: 1 - Bishr bin Harb. He said: 'He was trustworthy according to us.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 2 - And I asked Ali about Abu al-Muhazzim. He said: 'He was weak.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 3 - And I asked Ali about Matar al-Warraq. He said: 'He was righteous/acceptable (Salih), average (Wasat), and he was not strong.' 4 - And I asked Ali about Yazid al-Raqashi. He said: 'He was weak.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 5 - And I asked Ali about Hakim al-Athram. He said: 'Hakim was trustworthy according to us.' 6 - And I asked Ali about Yazid bin Ata'. He said: 'He was weak, and he is one of the clients (Mawali) of Abu Awanah.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 7 - And I asked Ali about al-Harith bin Nabhan. He said: 'He was weak, weak.' 8 - And I asked Ali about Mahdi bin Maymun. He said: 'Mahdi was trustworthy according to us.' 9 - And I asked Ali about Ibrahim bin Abdul-Malik Abu Isma'il...

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: ...al-Qannad. He said: 'He was weak according to us.' 10 - And I asked Ali about Ar'arah bin al-Barnd. He said: 'Ar'arah was trustworthy, firm (Thabt).' 11 - And I asked Ali about Marhum bin Abdul-Aziz al-Attar. He said: 'Marhum was from the trustworthy ones.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 12 - And I asked Ali about Abdul-Mu'min bin Ubayd Allah al-Basri. He said: 'He was righteous/acceptable (Salih), average (Wasat).' 13 - And I asked Ali about Abbad bin Mansur. He said: 'Weak according to us, and he was a Qadari (believer in free will), and he was a judge over Basra.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 14 - And I asked Ali about Ja'far bin Sulayman al-Duba'i. He said: 'Trustworthy according to us, though Yahya bin Sa'id did not narrate from him.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 15 - And I asked Ali about Zayd al-Ammi. He said: 'He was weak according to us.' 16 - And I asked Ali about Abbad bin Mansur. He said: 'Weak according to us, and he was a Qadari, and he was a judge over Basra.' 17 - And I asked Ali about Aban bin Abi Ayyash. He said: 'He was weak, weak according to us.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 18 - And I asked Ali about Abu Hurrah Wasil bin Abdur-Rahman. He said: 'He was weak.' 19 - 'And his brother Sa'id bin Abdur-Rahman was trustworthy according to us.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 20 - And I asked Ali about Salih al-Murri. He said: 'He is nothing; weak, weak.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 21 - And Muhammad bin Uthman told us, he said: I asked Ali about Ali bin Zayd Ibn Jud'an. He said: 'He is weak according to us.' 22 - And I asked Ali about Jarir bin Hazim...

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 23 - ...and his brother Yazid bin Hazim. He said: 'They were both trustworthy according to us.' 24 - And I asked Ali about Sawwar bin Abdullah the Judge. He said: 'He is trustworthy according to us.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 25 - And I asked Ali about al-Rabi' bin Sabih. He said: 'He is righteous/acceptable (Salih) according to us, not strong.' 26 - And I asked Ali about al-Mubarak bin Fadalah. He said: 'He is righteous/acceptable, average.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 27 - And I asked Ali about Nasr bin Tarif. He said: 'Weak, weak; his Hadith is not written.' 28 - And I asked Ali about Ayyub bin Khut. He said: 'Weak.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: weak, his Hadith is not written. 29 - And I asked Ali about Al-Qasim bin Al-Fadl Al-Huddani, and he said: He is trustworthy according to us. 30 - And I asked Ali about Yazid bin Ibrahim Al-Tustari, and he said: He is trustworthy according to us.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 31 - And I asked Ali about Uyainah bin Abdul-Rahman, and he said: Uyainah is trustworthy according to us. 32 - And I asked Ali about Al-Hasan bin Abi Ja'far, and he said: Weak, weak.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 33 - And I asked Ali about Abdul-A'la bin Abi Al-Musawir, and he said: Weak, he is nothing. 34 - And I asked Ali about Hammam bin Yahya, and he said: Trustworthy, firm.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 35 - And I asked Ali about Muhammad bin Thabit Al-Abdi, and he said: He is righteous (acceptable), not strong.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 36 - And I asked Ali about Abu Al-Ashhab Ja'far bin Hayyan, and he said: Trustworthy, firm. 37 - And I asked Ali about Hilal bin Abi Dawud Al-Habati, and he said: He was trustworthy. 38 - And I asked Ali about Nuh bin Qays Al-Huddani, and he said: He is righteous, and not strong.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 39 - And I asked Ali about Kharijah bin Mus'ab, and he said: He is weak according to us. 40 - And I asked Ali about Abu Hatrush, and he said: His name is Shamlah bin Hazzal, and he is weak according to us.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 41 - And I asked Ali about Adam bin Al-Hakam Al-Basri, and he said: Weak, weak. 42 - And I asked Ali about Sulayman bin Abi Sulayman Al-Qafalani, and he said: Weak, weak, he is nothing.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 43 - And I asked Ali about Abu Umayyah bin Ya'la, and he said: Weak. 44 - And I asked Ali about Adi bin Al-Mufaddal, and he said: He was weak. 45 - And I asked Ali about Amr bin Fa'id Al-Qurashi Al-Aswari

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: and he said: That one was weak according to us, and he used to speak of Qadar (predestination). 46 - And I asked Ali about Imran bin Zaid Al-Taghlibi, and he said: He was trustworthy, firm according to us. 47 - And I asked Ali about Awf Al-A'rabi, and he said: Trustworthy, firm.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 48 - And I asked about Kahmas bin Al-Hasan, and he said: Trustworthy, firm. 49 - And I asked Ali about Abu Ubaydah Al-Naji, and he said: He has

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: narrated from Al-Hasan, and he was trustworthy according to us. 50 - And I asked Ali about Aban bin Yazid Al-Attar, and he said: He was trustworthy according to us.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 51 - And I asked Ali about Salam bin Miskin, so it was said: Trustworthy, from the people of integrity. 52 - And I asked Ali about Al-Sari bin Yahya, and he said: He was trustworthy, firm.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 53 - And I asked Ali about Uthman Al-Barri, and he said: He was weak, he is nothing. 54 - And I asked Ali about Bistam bin Muslim, and he said: He was trustworthy according to us.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 55 - And I asked Ali about Abdul-Hamid bin Bahram, and he said: He was trustworthy according to us; he only used to narrate from Shahr bin Hawshab from a book he had. 56 - And I asked Ali about Abu Mawdud, and he said: He was righteous, there is no harm in him.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 57 - Muhammad bin Uthman told us, he said: I heard Ali when he was asked about Abu Abdullah Al-Shaqari, and he said: He was trustworthy according to us, and his name is Salamah bin Tammam. 58 - And I heard Ali when Amr bin Ubayd was mentioned, and he said: He is nothing, and we do not see narrating from him.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 59 - And Ali was asked about Al-Salt bin Dinar Al-Basri, and he said: That one was weak according to us, and his Kunyah is Abu Shu'ayb. 60 - And I heard Ali being asked about Hisham Abu Al-Miqdam, and he said: He was weak. 61 - And I heard Ali being asked about Abu Raihanah who narrates from

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: Safinah, and he said: He is righteous, average, there is no harm in him. 62 - And Ali was asked about Ibrahim bin Abdul-Malik Al-Basri while I was listening, and he said: That was a weak Sheikh, he is nothing. 63 - And Ali was asked about Al-Fadl bin Maymun while I was listening, and he said: He has always been weak, weak according to us. 64 - And he asked Ali while I was listening about Abu Aqil Yahya bin Al-Mutawakkil

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: so he said: That one is weak according to us, and his home was in Baghdad. 65 - And Ali was asked while I was listening about Muti' bin Maymun, and he said: That is a Sheikh who is trustworthy according to us. 66 - And he was asked about Sukayn bin Abdul-Aziz, and he said: He was a Sheikh, there is no harm in him. 67 - And I heard Ali being asked about Hammad bin Shu'ayb, and he said: Hammad has always been weak according to us, not strong.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 68 - And I asked Ali about Hashraj bin Nubatah, and he said: Hashraj was trustworthy according to us. 69 - And I heard Ali say: Zakariya bin Yahya Al-Dira' is trustworthy.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 70 - And I heard Ali, when Umarah bin Zadhan Al-Saydalani was mentioned, say: Yahya has narrated Hadiths from him. 71 - And I heard Ali say: Muhammad bin Juhadah used to be accused of something regarding Qadar.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 72 - I heard Ali say: Abu Awanah sold his book. 73 - I heard Ali say: When I used to come to Baghdad forty years ago, the one who would discuss [Hadith] was Ahmad bin Hanbal. Sometimes we would disagree on something, so we would ask Abu Zakariya Yahya bin Ma'in. He would get up and bring it out...

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: ...how well he knew the location of his Hadith! 74 - I heard Ali say: The companions of Abu Hurayrah are these six: Sa'id bin al-Musayyib, Abu Salamah, al-A'raj, Abu Salih, Muhammad bin Sirin, and Tawus. And Hammam Ibn Munabbih's Hadith resembled their Hadith except for [a few] letters. Muhammad bin Uthman told us, he said: I heard Ali say: I said to Abdur-Rahman bin...

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: ...Mahdi while I was with him, and he had brought out the book of Hammam to me. I said to him: 'Hand it over so I can look into it.' He said: 'Let me be until I dictate to you. When I finish with them, then look into it.' So he dictated to me, then he tossed the book to me. I did not find anything in it except well-known Hadiths, and I did not write anything from it. He said: 'Do you think I would leave anything from it that you would want?' 75 - I heard Ali say: Mina, the client (Mawla) of Humayd bin Abdur-Rahman, is nothing. 76 - I heard Ali say: We looked, and behold, Yahya bin Sa'id narrates...

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: ...from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib what no one else narrates the likes of. And we looked, and behold, al-Zuhri narrates from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib something no one else narrated. And we looked, and behold, Qatadah narrates from Sa'id bin al-Musayyib something no one else narrated. 77 - I heard Ali say: My father Abdullah bin Ja'far said: Shu'bah said: 'My mother died, so al-Taymi and Ibn Awn came to me...'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: ...so al-Taymi narrated a Hadith from Abu Nadrah. Ibn Awn said: 'Did you see Abu Nadrah?' Al-Taymi said to him: 'You saw Abu Nadrah?' 78 - I heard Ali say: I do not memorize [any narration] from Khalid from Sa'id Ibn Abi al-Hasan except this Hadith—meaning the Hadith of Umm Salamah: 'The transgressing party will kill Ammar.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 79 - And I asked Ali about Sheikhs from the people of Hijaz and others. I asked him about Salih, the client (Mawla) of al-Taw'amah. He said: 'Salih is trustworthy (Thiqah), except that he became senile and old. A group heard from him while he was senile and old, so their hearing...'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: ...is not correct. Sufyan al-Thawri is among those who heard from him after he became senile. And Ibn Abi Dhi'b had heard from him before he became senile.' 80 - And I asked Ali about Abu al-Zubayr al-Makki. He said: 'Trustworthy, firm (Thabt). His name is Muhammad bin Muslim, and he was a client of Ibn Hizam.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 81 - And I asked Ali about Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil. He said: 'He was weak.' 82 - And I asked Ali about Husayn bin Abdullah bin Ubaydullah bin Abbas. He said: 'He was weak, he is nothing.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 83 - And I asked Ali about Muhammad bin Ishaq bin Yasar, the client of the family of Makhramah. He said: 'He is righteous/acceptable (Salih), average (Wasat).'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 84 - And I asked Ali about Kathir bin Abdullah al-Muzani. He said: 'Weak.' 85 - And I asked Ali about Hamzah bin Abi Hamzah al-Madani. He said: 'He was weak.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 86 - And I asked Ali about Salih bin Muhammad bin Za'idah al-Madani. He said: 'He was weak.' 87 - And I asked Ali about Abu Hazrah. He said: 'The name of Abu Hazrah is Ya'qub bin Mujahid. He was trustworthy (Thiqah) according to us, and he was a storyteller in Medina.' 88 - And I asked Ali about Muslim al-Khayyat. He said: 'He was trustworthy according to us.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 89 - And I asked Ali about al-Qasim bin al-Abbas. He said: 'He was trustworthy.' 90 - And I asked Ali about Abu al-Huwayrith. He said: 'He was trustworthy according to us. Al-Thawri, Shu'bah, and Sufyan bin Uyaynah narrated from him. Shu'bah used to say: Abu al-Huwayrithah.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 91 - And I asked Ali about Sa'd bin Ibrahim bin Abdur-Rahman bin Awf. He said: 'Our companions used to accuse him of [holding the views of] Qadar. He was trustworthy (Thiqah), firm (Thabt) according to us. Malik bin Anas used to speak against him, and Malik did not narrate anything from him. Sa'd had attacked Malik regarding his lineage.' 92 - And I asked Ali about Abdus-Salam, the client of Quraysh. He said: 'He was trustworthy according to us.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 93 - And I asked Ali about Musa bin Uqbah. He said: 'Trustworthy, firm.' 94 - And I asked Ali about Muhammad bin Amr bin Alqamah. He said: 'He was trustworthy. Yahya bin Sa'id used to weaken him somewhat.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 95 - And I asked Ali about Abu Jabir al-Bayadi. He said: 'He is not among the people of trustworthiness according to us.' 96 - And I asked Ali about Musa bin Muhammad bin Ibrahim. He said: 'He was weak, weak, weak.' 97 - And I asked Ali about Kathir bin Zayd. He said: 'He is righteous/acceptable (Salih), but not strong.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 98 - And I asked Ali about Usamah bin Zayd bin Aslam. He said: 'He is trustworthy according to us, but not strong. Our companions have denounced some Hadiths of his. The sons of Zayd bin Aslam—among them Abdur-Rahman and others—all of the sons of Zayd are not strong.' 99 - And I asked him about Abdullah bin Abi Najih al-Makki. He said: 'As for...'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: '...Hadith, he is trustworthy in it. As for opinion, he was a Qadari and a Mu'tazili.' 100 - And I asked Ali about Hanzalah bin Abi Sufyan. He said: 'Hanzalah and his brother Amr bin Abi Sufyan were Meccans from Bani Jumah, and they were both trustworthy.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 101 - And I asked Ali about Ubaydullah bin al-Walid (al-Wassafi). He said: 'He was from Bani Ijl, and he was weak, he is nothing.' 102 - And I asked him about Musa bin Ibrahim al-Madani who used to narrate from Salamah bin al-Akwa'. He said: 'He was righteous/acceptable (Salih), average (Wasat).' 103 - And I asked Ali about Usamah bin Zayd al-Laythi. He said: 'That one was trustworthy according to us.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 104 - And I asked Ali about Musa bin Ali bin Rabah al-Lakhmi. He said: 'He was trustworthy, firm according to us.' 105 - And I asked Ali about Abdul-Hamid bin Ja'far al-Ansari...

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: ...He said: 'He used to profess [the doctrine of] Qadar (free will), and he was trustworthy according to us, but Sufyan al-Thawri used to weaken him.' 106 - And I asked Ali about Abu Ma'shar al-Madani. He said: 'That was a weak, weak Sheikh. He used to narrate from Muhammad bin Qays, and he used to narrate from Muhammad bin Ka'b acceptable Hadiths, and he used to narrate...'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: from Al-Maqburi and from Nafi with denounced Hadiths. 107 - And I asked him about Sulayman bin Bilal, and he said: He was trustworthy according to us, in charge of the market. 108 - And I asked him about Abu Ghassan Muhammad bin Mutarrif, and he said: He was an average, righteous Sheikh.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 109 - And I asked him about Hisham bin Sa'd, and he said: He is righteous, but he was not strong. 110 - And I asked Ali about Muhammad bin Abdul-Rahman, the Mawla of the family of Talha, and he said: He was trustworthy according to us, though I have rejected some Hadiths from him. 111 - And I asked Ali about Abdullah bin Muslim bin Hurmuz, and he said: He was weak, weak according to us, and he is Meccan.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 112 - And I asked Ali about Abdul-Aziz bin Omar bin Abdul-Aziz, and he said: Abdul-Aziz was firm and trustworthy, and trustworthy people have narrated from him, [such as] Ibn Abi Dhi'b and others. 113 - And Muhammad bin Uthman told us, he said: I heard Ali on the pulpit saying: Whoever claims that the Quran is created has disbelieved; and whoever claims that Allah, Mighty and Majestic, is not seen [in the Hereafter] is a disbeliever; and whoever claims that Allah, Mighty and Majestic, did not speak to Musa in reality is a disbeliever. 114 - Muhammad told us, he said: I asked Ali about Omar bin Abdul-Rahman bin Dilaf, and he said: He was trustworthy.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 115 - And I asked Ali about Talha bin Abdul-Malik Al-Ayli, and he said: Malik bin Anas has narrated from him, and he was trustworthy and firm according to us. 116 - And I asked Ali about Amr bin Shu'ayb, and he said: What Ayyub and Ibn Jurayj narrated from him, all of that is authentic. And what Amr narrated from his father from his grandfather, that is a book he found, so it is weak.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 117 - And I asked Ali [about] Abu Salih Al-Zayyat, and he said: That one, narrated

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: from him Al-A'mash and Mansur, and he was trustworthy and firm according to us, and his name was Dhakwan. 118 - And Abu Salih, from whom Ismail bin Abi Khalid narrated the Tafsir (exegesis), his name is Badham, and he was the Mawla of Umm Hani bint Abi Talib; he is not that [strong], he is weak.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 119 - And I asked him about Abu Salih Al-Hanafi, and he said: Firm, firm. 120 - And I asked him about Abu Salih, the Mawla of Duba'ah, and he said: He was firm, and he was from the Tabi'un, and he is the one from whom the people of Kufa narrate.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 121 - And I asked him about Abu Salih Zuhra bin Ma'bad, the Mawla of Uthman bin Affan, and he said: Zuhra was trustworthy and firm, and he narrated from Uthman, may the pleasure of Allah be upon him. Al-Saqati said: Ali bin Omar Al-Daraqutni said: This is what Ibn Abi Shaybah said from Ali, but in my view it is an illusion (error), because Zuhra bin Ma'bad's Kunyah was Abu

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: Aqil, and he did not meet Uthman bin Affan, nor did he narrate from him, nor did he catch his time. He only narrates from Abu Salih, the Mawla of Uthman bin Affan. And it is said that the name of Abu Salih from whom Zuhra narrates is Al-Harith, the Mawla of Uthman; he narrates from Uthman and from Abu Huraira. And Allah knows best. 122 - And Muhammad bin Uthman told us, he said: And I asked Ali about Abu Salih

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: from whom Sulayman Al-Taymi narrated, and he said: He was firm according to us, and he is a Tabi'i, his name is Mizan. 123 - And I asked him about Abu Salih from whom Yahya bin Abi Kathir narrated, and he said: He was trustworthy and firm, and he used to be called Qaylulah, and he was from the Tabi'un. 124 - And I asked him about Abu Salih, the companion of Al-Kalbi, and Simak has narrated from him, and he said: That is the Mawla of Umm Hani, and he is weak, and he was from the Tabi'un. Ali said: And Abu Salih had three sons,

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: all of them trustworthy: Sahl bin Abi Salih, Abbad bin Abi Salih, and Salih bin Abi Salih; all of them are trustworthy and firm. 125 - And I asked Ali about Abdul-Wahhab bin Mujahid, and he said: Not trustworthy, and his Hadith is not written. 126 - And I asked Ali about Abdul-Rahman bin Ishaq Al-Madani,

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: so he said: He is according to us righteous (acceptable), average, but Yahya bin Sa'id used to weaken him. 127 - And I asked Ali about Talha bin Amr, and he said: He is Meccan, weak, he is nothing.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 128 - And I asked Ali about Al-Qasim bin Abdullah Al-Umari, and he said: That one is weak according to us, he is nothing. 129 - And I asked Ali about Husain bin Zaid bin Ali, and he said: There was weakness in him, but his Hadith is written. Abu Ja'far said: Ali narrated to us from him on the pulpit - meaning Husain. 130 - And I asked Ali about Abu Amir Al-Khazzaz, so Ali said: He used to

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: narrate to people from Ibn Abi Mulaykah, and he was weak, he is nothing. 131 - And I asked Ali about Muslim bin Khalid Al-Zanji, and he said: He was weak according to us, not strong. 132 - And I asked Ali about Omar bin Qays Al-Makki, so he said: He was

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: weak, weak, he is nothing. They used to nickname him Sandal. 133 - And I asked Ali about Sa'id bin Salim Al-Qaddah, and he said: He was trustworthy, but he was not strong. 134 - And I asked Ali about Muhammad bin Abdul-Rahman bin Al-Mughira bin Abi Dhi'b, and he said: He was trustworthy according to us, but they used to consider him weak in things he narrated from Al-Zuhri.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 135 - And I asked Ali about Hakim bin Ruzayq, and he said: He was trustworthy and firm. 136 - And I asked Ali about Harun, and he said: He was a Sheikh, there is no harm in him; he narrated from Sa'id bin Al-Musayyib, and the Kufans have narrated from him.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 137 - And I asked Ali about Fulaih bin Sulayman, and he said: Fulaih and his brother Abdul-Hamid were weak. 138 - And I asked Ali about Abdullah bin Amir Al-Aslami, and he said: That one is weak, weak according to us.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 139 - And I asked Ali about Ismail bin Ibrahim bin Uqbah, and he said: That one was from the people of Medina, and he was trustworthy according to us. 140 - And I asked Ali about Hatim bin Ismail, and he said: Hatim was trustworthy and firm according to us. 141 - And I asked Ali about Anas bin Iyad, and he said: He was from the people of Medina, and he was trustworthy according to us.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 142 - And I heard Ali saying: The sons of Abu Mahdhurah who narrate from their grandfather, all of them are weak, they are nothing. 143 - I said to Ali: O Abu Al-Hasan, what do you say about Ayyub bin Sayyar? He said: That one was not trustworthy according to us; his Hadith is not written.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 144 - And I asked Ali about Marwan bin Mu'awiyah, and he said: He was considered trustworthy, but he used to narrate from people who were not trustworthy and he would use Kunyahs for their names. 145 - And I asked Ali about Musa bin Ubayda Al-Rabadhi, and he said: He was weak, weak. Yahya Al-Qattan did not see that his Hadith should be written.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 146 - And I asked Ali about Yunus bin al-Harith al-Ta'ifi, so he said: 'We used to consider that one severely weak.' 147 - And I heard Ali say: 'Ibrahim bin Adham was trustworthy, and he was among the most devout of people.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 148 - And I heard Ali say: 'Abu Ja'far al-Razi was trustworthy according to us.' 149 - And I asked Ali about Muhammad bin al-Walid al-Zubaydi, so he said: 'He was trustworthy, firm according to us.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 150 - And I heard Ali say: 'The nephew of al-Zuhri is weak, not strong, but we write his Hadith.' 151 - And I heard Ali say: 'Al-Walid bin Muhammad al-Muwaqqari is weak, he is nothing; and he had narrated from al-Zuhri, but we do not narrate anything from him.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 152 - And I heard Ali say: 'Ziyad bin Sa'd is trustworthy, firm.' 153 - And I heard Ali say: 'Ibrahim bin Abi Yahya is a liar, and he used to profess [the doctrine of] Qadar.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 154 - 'And his brother Anis bin Abi Yahya was trustworthy according to us.' 155 - And I heard him, and he was asked about Shibl bin Abbad al-Makki, so he said: 'Average (Wasat), and there was no harm in him.' 156 - Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah told us, he said: I heard Ali, and he was asked about Abbad bin Kathir, so he said: 'He was nothing, and he is...'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: '...from the people of Basra, except that he used to reside in Makkah.' 157 - 'However, Abbad bin Kathir al-Ramli was trustworthy, there is no harm in him.' 158 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Harithah bin Abi al-Rijal, so he said: 'Our companions ceased not to weaken him.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 159 - 'And his brother Abdur-Rahman bin Abi al-Rijal was sounder than him in Hadith, and he used to reside in al-Sham.' 160 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Abdul-Aziz al-Darawardi, so he said: 'He is trustworthy, firm according to us.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 161 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Yazid bin Iyad bin Ju'diyah, so he said: 'Weak, weak, he is nothing.' 162 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Ibn Abi Sabrah, so he said: 'He was...'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: '...weak in Hadith, and Ibn Jurayj had taken from him by way of Munawalah (handing over a book).'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 163 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Sa'id bin Sam'an, so he said: 'Ibn Abi Dhi'b indeed narrated from him, and he is trustworthy according to us.' 164 - And I heard Ali, and Ibn Abi Hazim was mentioned, so he said: 'Hatim bin Isma'il used to criticize him regarding Hadiths he narrated from his father.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: And Muhammad bin Uthman told us, he said: I heard my father say: 'I wanted to hear [Hadith] from Abdul-Aziz bin Abi Hazim, so we came to Hatim while he was in his shop, and we asked him about him. He said: He has narrated from his father Hadiths which we forbade him from [narrating], but he did not desist.' He said: So we did not write from him. 165 - Muhammad told us, he said: And I heard Ali, and Abdur-Rahman bin Abi al-Zinad was mentioned to him, so he said: 'He was weak according to our companions.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 166 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Ya'qub bin Muhammad bin Tahla, so he said: 'He was righteous/acceptable (Salih) and he was from the people of Medina.' 167 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Abdul-Wahhab bin al-Ward, so he said: 'He was a devout worshipper, he was from the people of Makkah, and our companions used to consider him trustworthy.' 168 - And Ali was asked while I was listening about Abdullah bin Ziyad bin Sam'an, so he said: 'That one is weak, weak according to us.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 169 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Ikrimah bin Ammar, so he said: 'He was trustworthy, firm according to our companions.' 170 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Ayyub bin Utbah al-Yamami, so he said: '[He is] weak according to our companions.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 171 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about al-Hakam bin Abdullah al-Ayli, so he said: 'He was weak, he is nothing.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 172 - And about Abdul-Jabbar bin Umar al-Ayli, so he said: 'He was nothing.' 173 - And about Abu Uways al-Madani, so he said: 'He was weak according to our companions.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 174 - And about Muhammad bin Muslim al-Ta'ifi, so he said: 'He was righteous/acceptable (Salih), average (Wasat).' 175 - And about Attaf bin Khalid al-Makhzumi, so he said: 'He was trustworthy according to us and according to our companions.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 176 - And I heard Ali say: 'Isma'il bin Ja'far and his brother Muhammad bin Ja'far, the Medinans, are both trustworthy.' 177 - And I heard Ali say: 'Rumays bin Muhammad al-Makki, from the people of Khurasan, is acceptable in Hadith, there is no harm in him.' 178 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Munkadir bin Muhammad bin al-Munkadir, so he said: 'He is righteous/acceptable according to us, but not strong.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 179 - And about Habib bin Abdur-Rahman bin Ardak, so he said: 'He was weak.' 180 - And about Abdul-Malik bin Qudamah al-Jumahi, so he said: 'There is no harm in him.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 181 - 'And his brother Salih bin Qudamah also, there is no harm in him.' 182 - And about Abdullah bin Sa'd bin Abi Hind, so he said: 'He was trustworthy according to our companions.' 183 - 'And as for Abdullah bin Sa'id al-Maqburi, he was nothing.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 184 - And Muhammad bin Uthman told us, so he said: Ali was asked while I was present about Ibrahim bin Abi al-Nadr al-Madini, so he said: 'His nickname was Bardan, and he was trustworthy according to our companions.' 185 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Abu Mawdud al-Madini, so he said: 'Righteous/acceptable, there is no harm in him.'

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 186 - I heard Ali, when Nafi' bin Abi Nu'aym Al-Qari was mentioned, say: There was no harm in him according to us. 187 - I heard Ali being asked about Hammad Al-Khayyat, and he said: He was trustworthy according to us, and he was from the people of Medina.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 188 - And about Musa bin Abi Al-Furat, he said: He was trustworthy according to us. 189 - And about Ishaq bin Yahya bin Talha bin Ubayd Allah, he said: He was weak, he is nothing. 190 - And about Omar bin Suhban Al-Madani, he said: He was weak, his Hadith is not written, and he is nothing.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 191 - I heard Ali say: Abdullah bin Muslim bin Hurmuz Al-Makki is weak, weak. 192 - And I heard Ali being asked about Al-Harith bin Abdul-Rahman, whom Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrated from, and he said: He is not Al-Harith bin Abi Dhubab.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 193 - I heard Ali being asked about Abu Omar Al-San'ani, and he said: We used to consider him trustworthy, but he was criticized regarding his hearing (receiving of Hadith), that it was by presentation (Ardan).

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 194 - And I heard Ali being asked about Asim bin Sulayman Al-Ahwal, and he said: He was trustworthy. 195 - And about Ayman bin Nabil, he said: He was trustworthy, but not strong.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 196 - And about Isa bin Abi Isa Al-Hannat, he said: He was weak and not strong. 197 - And about Abu Sufyan, whom Abu Muhammad Al-A'mash narrated from, he said: His name is Talha bin Nafi', and our companions used to weaken him in his Hadith.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: And about Al-Walid bin Abi Al-Walid, he said: He was righteous, average; and no one narrated from him except the Egyptians. 199 - I heard Ali say: Rawh bin Aslam, his Hadith is gone - meaning lost.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 200 - I heard Ali say: Ishaq bin Idris is nothing. 201 - I heard Ali say: Yunus bin Bukayr, I have written from him, but I do not narrate from him. Muhammad said: I saw - and in his book on Sales there was a Hadith from him, meaning Yunus bin Bukayr - so he said: Hand over a copy to Abu Abdul-Rahman - meaning Ibn Hasan - he narrates from him. Muhammad said: Yahya Al-Himmani said to me: We do not consider narrating from him to be lawful.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 202 - And Muhammad told us, he said: I heard Ali say: Umayyah bin Shibl, there is no harm in his Hadith. 203 - And I heard Ali say: Abdul-Razzaq was more like the People of Hadith than Hisham bin Yusuf; Abdul-Razzaq used to discuss (Hadith).

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 204 - And I heard Ali say: A Hadith I heard from Qatada from Anas from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, 'O men...', no one narrated it except Yazid bin Harun. 205 - And Ali was asked about Abu Bakr Al-Dahiri, and he said: He is nothing, his Hadith is not written.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 206 - And about Ibrahim bin Adham, he said: He was trustworthy according to us, one of the most worshipping of people. 207 - And about Ibrahim bin Abi Ablah, he said: He was one of the trustworthy ones. 208 - And about Muhammad bin Ziyad Al-Alhani, he said: Trustworthy, trusted.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 209 - And about Hariz bin Uthman, he said: Those whom we met from our companions did not consider him trustworthy.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 210 - And I asked Ali about Al-Qasim Abu Abdul-Rahman, the companion of Abu Umamah, and he said: He was trustworthy according to us and according to those whom we met from our companions. 211 - And Ali was asked while I was listening about Zur'ah bin Ibrahim, and he said: He was considered weak, and he was not strong. 212 - And I heard Ali say: Abdul-Aziz bin Ubayd Allah bin Hamza Ibn Suhayb Al-Lakhmi was weak.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 213 - And Humayd bin Malik Al-Lakhmi was weak. And Ismail bin Ayyash used to narrate from these two individuals. 214 - I heard Ali, when Ata bin Ajlan was mentioned in his presence, say: That was a weak Sheikh, he is nothing. 215 - And I heard Ali being asked about Amir bin Najih, and he said: Our companions used to consider him trustworthy.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 216 - I heard Ali say: Isa bin Sinan 217 - and Sa'id bin Sinan are both weak - the Syrian. 218 - And I asked Ali about Ali bin Yazid, and he said: He was weak.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: And I asked him about Ja'far bin Al-Zubayr, and he said: Ja'far, his Hadith is not written; he was weak, not worth anything. 220 - I heard Ali being asked about Abdul-Rahman bin Ziyad bin An'am, and he said: Our companions used to weaken him, and our companions denounced Hadiths he used to narrate that are not known.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 221 - I heard Ali being asked about Abdul-Rahman bin Ruman, and he said: That is a weak Sheikh. 222 - And Muhammad told us, he said: I heard Abu Shu'ayb Al-Hajjam asking Ali about Khulayd bin Da'laj, and he said: Khulayd was weak. 223 - I asked Ali about Sa'id bin Bashir, and he said: He was weak.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 224 - And I asked Ali about Uthman bin Ata, and he said: He was weak. 225 - And about Mu'an bin Rifa'ah, he said: He was a weak Sheikh.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 226 - And about Yazid bin Abdul-Aziz, he said: He was considered weak. This Yazid is a Syrian; this is what Abu Ja'far said. 227 - And I asked him about Khalid bin Yazid bin Abi Malik, and he said: He was weak. 228 - And I asked him about Utbah bin Abi Hakim Al-Shaibani, and he said: He was weak.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin Al-Madini
text: 229 - And about Musa bin Ayyub Al-Ghafiqi, he said: He was trustworthy, but I denounce some of his Hadiths that he narrated from his uncle, for he used to elevate them (to the Prophet). 230 - And I asked Ali about Yahya bin Hamza Al-Dimashqi, and he said: He was trustworthy according to our companions. 231 - And about Muhammad bin Muhajir, he said: He was average.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 232 - And about Muhammad bin Rashid, he said: He was trustworthy. 233 - And about Isma'il bin Ayyash, he said: He was trusted in what he narrated from his companions, the people of Sham (the Levant); but as for what he narrated from other than the people of Sham, there is weakness in it.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 234 - And about al-Faraj bin Fadalah, he said: He is average (Wasat) and not strong. 235 - And I asked him about a Sheikh from whom Abu Isma'il al-Mu'addib narrated, who is called...

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: ...Sulayman bin Abi Hind, the client of Zayd bin al-Khattab. He said: We asked about this Sheikh, and our companions mentioned that there was no harm in him. 236 - Muhammad told us, he said: And Ali said: Some of my companions discussed with me a Hadith from Abu Dhi'b from Abdullah bin Rafi'—and this is a mistake, it is actually Abdullah bin Abi Nafi'—that he prayed behind Abu Hurayrah and he recited {When the sky has split} and he prostrated during it.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 237 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Rashid bin Sa'd al-Absi. He said: He was weak, he is nothing, and his Hadith is not written. 238 - And I heard Ali say: Qatadah did not hear anything from Sulayman al-Yashkuri. What he narrated from him was from a scroll that he read to him, or someone who heard it from Sulayman al-Yashkuri read it to him. Ali told us: Sufyan Ibn Uyaynah told us: He said: I heard al-Zuhri say: Al-Hasan Ibn Muhammad told me—and Hasan was more trustworthy in our view, while Abdullah used to...

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: ...follow his Hadith from their father from Ali, that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, forbade Mut'ah marriage and the meat of domestic donkeys. And Muhammad told us: He said: I heard Ali say: I do not know if Qatadah heard from Abu [...] or not; Abu [...] was from the people of Khurasan. I heard Ali say: Qatadah heard from al-Mughirah bin Sulayman. I heard Ali say: I do not think Qatadah heard from Abu Thumamah al-Thaqafi.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 239 - And Ali was asked while I was listening about Abu Qatadah al-Harrani. He said: Our companions used to weaken him. 240 - And Ali was asked about Yusuf bin Atiyah al-Saffar. He said: He was weak.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 241 - And Ali was asked while I was listening about Salam bin Salim al-Tawil. He said: He had denounced (Munkar) Hadiths. 242 - And Ali was asked while I was listening about Attab bin Bashir. He said: Our companions used to weaken him.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 243 - And Ali was asked about Muhammad bin Salamah al-Harrani. He said: Muhammad was trustworthy. 244 - And about Abu al-Rabi' al-Samman. He said: He was weak. 245 - And about Mahdi bin Hilal. He said: He was accused of lying.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 246 - And I heard Ali [speak] about Mu'alla bin Hilal. He said: The Hadith of the likes of Mu'alla is not written; he was not trustworthy. 247 - I heard Ali [speak] about Sulayman bin Qarm. He said: He was not strong, and he is acceptable (Salih). 248 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about Uqbah al-Asam. He said: He was weak.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 249 - And I heard Ali say: Al-Hasan bin Dinar is weak, he is nothing. 250 - I heard Ali say: Abu Rayhanah, the one who narrates from Safinah...

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: ...is acceptable (Salih), average (Wasat), there is no harm in him. 251 - And I heard Ali say, and he was asked about al-Nadr bin Arabi. He said: Al-Nadr was trustworthy according to our companions. 252 - And I heard Ali, and he was asked about al-Haytham bin Jammaz. He said: He was weak according to our companions.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 253 - And he was asked about Ziyad al-Saffar Abu Umar. He said: He was weak according to our companions. 254 - And I heard Ali say: Abu Hurmuz, who narrates from Anas, is weak, weak, he is nothing.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 255 - And I heard Ali, and Ghalib bin Ubayd Allah al-Jazari was mentioned to him. He said: He was weak, he is nothing. 256 - And I heard Ali, and Ma'qil bin Ubayd Allah was mentioned [to him]. He said: Ma'qil was trustworthy according to his companions. 257 - And I heard Ali say: Quraysh bin Hayyan is trustworthy.

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: 258 - Muhammad bin Uthman told us, he said: I heard Ali say: Hazm bin Abi Hazm is trustworthy. 259 - And he was asked about Abu al-Malih. He said: He was trustworthy according to our companions. 260 - And Ali was asked while I was listening about Musa bin A'yun. He said: He was acceptable (Salih), average (Wasat).

book_title: Questions of Muhammad bin Uthman bin Abi Shaybah to Ali bin al-Madini
text: The end of what was transcribed from the original, thus from the Questions. Praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds, and may Allah bless our Master Muhammad and his Family. Allah is sufficient for us, and He is the best Disposer of affairs.
